elements.title: premiers of Victoria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that premiers of Victoria get a bronze statue (example pictured) if they hold office for more than 3,000 days?

elements.title: Julia Marden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julia Marden was the first known person to create a Wampanoag twined turkey-feather mantle since European contact 400 years earlier?

elements.title: plants (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aristotle classified living things based on whether they had a "sensitive soul" or, like plants, only a "vegetative soul"?

elements.title: Liu Weining (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Liu Weining, grandson of the second president of the People's Republic of China, became involved with Russian military secrecy due to his job and was denied the ability to travel to China?

elements.title: permafrost (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there are at least 13,000 sites containing toxic materials that are frozen in permafrost, many of which are expected to start thawing and releasing their pollutants in the near future?

elements.title: Songs and Flowers of the Wasatch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Songs and Flowers of the Wasatch represented a shift in Mormon history toward a "socially-accepted American cultural and religious heritage", according to historian Jennifer Reeder?

elements.title: Righteous Revenge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that it is debated whether the 1919 kino-drama Righteous Revenge can be considered the first Korean film?

elements.title: Sinderella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jim Davidson's Sinderella featured a flatulent Fairy Godmother?
